app-description: Sunrise is a specialized Data Availability Layer for Proof of Liquidity (PoL).
about-1: We're thrilled to announce our latest public sale of 2025 with Sunrise - The first specialized Data Availability Layer for Proof of Liquidity (PoL).
about-2: Sunrise is an innovative Data Availability Layer that remodels how developers build and scale applications. By leveraging our unique Proof of Liquidity model and Fee Abstraction capabilities, you can create secure, liquid, and cost-effective rollups and Layer 2 solutions without the burden of traditional DA fees.
answer-1: Sunrise reduces liquidity fragmentation on L2 rollups, while also simultaneously increasing liquidity for their own token.
answer-2: Sunrise is the first specialized DA layer to implement native DA Fee Abstraction.
answer-3: Sunrise has highly scalable off-chain blob space which enables the creation of new fully on-chain use cases such as Decentralized AI, Gaming, and more.
answer-4: Sunrise introduces Extended Proof of Liquidity which enables Sunrise to participate in a mutually beneficial relationship with Berachain’s liquidity environment by extending Berachain’s PoL to the L2 level

fundamentals.title: Fundamentals
fundamentals.description: Sunrise is an innovative Data Availability Layer that remodels how developers build and scale applications. By leveraging our unique Proof of Liquidity model and Fee Abstraction capabilities, you can create secure, liquid, and cost-effective rollups and Layer 2 solutions without the burden of traditional DA fees.

level-1-desc: Sunrise uses the PoL consensus model to deepen both security and liquidity for L2 rollups. Sunrise’s DEX and cross-chain infrastructure let the rollup tap into a single, high-throughput marketplace for liquidity. The benefits for rollups include reducing liquidity fragmentation and increasing liquidity for the rollup’s native token.
level-2-desc-1: Sunrise introduces “DA Fee Abstraction,” allowing developers to secure blobspace by providing liquidity rather than paying fees exclusively in a single token. This approach reduces reliance on one asset type, giving projects more economic flexibility and making it easier to manage costs.
level-2-desc-2: By providing assets as liquidity in Sunrise’s pools, liquidity providers align their success with the DA network’s overall health, thus driving a more collaborative ecosystem.
level-3-desc: Sunrise is designed for high-throughput data availability, offering enhanced scalability and flexibility for applications even such as gaming. Utilizing decentralized storage solutions such as IPFS and Arweave, data shards are stored externally.
key-feature-1: OFF-CHAIN ERASURE ENCODING: Computational and storage load on validators is minimized by having the blob data erasure-coded off-chain.
key-feature-2: OFF-CHAIN STORAGE INTEGRATION: On-chain block size requirements for blob transactions are reduced and scalability is enhanced by using off chain blobs powered by IPFS and Arweave.
comparision-title: Comparison Between On-Chain DA Attestation & Off-Chain DA Attestation
level-4-desc: The protocol generates revenue through three channels.
revenue-2: Swap fees in the liquidity pool
closer-title: A closer look into the DA space...
sales-details-desc: We can change from 6-10% by adjusting community allocation 2% distribution.

note-locked:
Note: locked tokens may be staked.
RISE tokens received from staking are unlocked
dual-token-system-1: $vRISE: Non-Transferable token for staking and governance
dual-token-system-1-desc: Used for calculating voting power in governance
token-description: $RISE token is the native token of Sunrise Network
token-usecase-1-desc-1: $RISE token can be used for fees. A portion of transaction fees in $RISE tokens is burned, reducing the circulating supply and adding deflationary pressure to the token. This portion is determined by a percentage of the total gas cost. The burn mechanism aligns with Sunrise Layer's sustainable design and ensures efficient fee management.
token-usecase-1-desc-2: The $vRISE token is a non-transferable token for staking. The staked amount will be calculated as a voting power for the governance.
token-usecase-2-desc: $vRISE can be staked to the Sunrise network. The staked amount will be calculated as a voting power for the governance. Furthermore, the rewards for stakers will be distributed in proportion to the staked amount.
token-usecase-3-desc: A Gauge means our product that issues vRISE. The Gauge’s first product in Sunrise is the Liquidity Pool. vRISE holders use vRISE to vote and determine how much vRISE to allocate to which gauge. More vRISE newly issued will be allocated to the liquidity pool linked to the gauge that has collected more vRISE voting power.

join-sunrise-desc: Be part of the next generation of blockchain infratructure
glosarry-1: DA Layer: A Data Availability (DA) layer ensures all transaction data is accessible and verifiable, so chains or rollups can focus on execution without storing everything on-chain. Think of it as the storage backbone that guarantees data can be checked by anyone.
glosarry-2: Blob / Blobspace: “Blobs” are large chunks of data handled separately from typical on-chain transactions to reduce congestion. “Blobspace” is the dedicated capacity for these data chunks, allowing for bigger, more flexible data storage.
glosarry-3: Liquidity Fragmentation: When crypto assets are split across multiple platforms, access to large, unified liquidity pools becomes difficult, increasing trading costs and complexity.
glosarry-4: Proof of Liquidity (PoL): Proof of Liquidity (PoL) is a novel consensus mechanism that strengthens a chain’s security by requiring participants to provide on-chain liquidity.
glosarry-5: Fee Abstraction: The ability to pay for network services (like storing data) with multiple kinds of assets, rather than one specific token. It simplifies costs by letting participants contribute liquidity in whatever form suits them best.
glosarry-6: Rollup/L2: A second-layer protocol built on top of a main blockchain to handle more transactions at lower costs. Rollups batch or execute transactions off the main chain while still relying on it for security or final settlement. Optimism and Arbitrum are well known examples.
